definitions.example: The bomb went off right after the president left his office.
The gun went off during their struggle.

definitions.definition: To explode metaphorically; to become very angry.
definitions.example: It all went off when the opposing teams' fans met at the railway station.

definitions.definition: To begin clanging or making noise.
definitions.example: Just after he spotted the first plane on the horizon, sirens started to go off around the city.

definitions.definition: To stop operating; to switch off.
definitions.example: We were watching TV when suddenly the power went off.
Having sated her appetite, she went off in search of a place to sleep.

definitions.definition: To putrefy or become inedible, or to become unusable in any way.

definitions.example: Ever since falling off her bike, she's gone off cycling to work.

definitions.definition: To pass off; to take place; to be accomplished.
definitions.example: The party went off very well.
